TITLE: How Paynter Jacket Co. Found Success With Limited-Edition Chore Coats
SUMMARY: Paynter Jacket Co., a small label in London, has built a loyal following thanks to its limited-edition chore coats.

TITLE: Can Maxim’s Restaurant in Paris Reclaim It’s Cool After 130 Years?
SUMMARY: That’s the hope at the restaurant Maxim’s in Paris, which recently started a new chapter after 130 years in business.

TITLE: In a New Cannabis Landscape, a Navy Veteran Battles for Racial Equity
SUMMARY: Wanda James is on a mission to empower entrepreneurs from communities harmed by racial disparities in marijuana arrests.

TITLE: In the South, Gas Stations Are Temples of Commerce and Community
SUMMARY: Are they gas stations that serve food or restaurants that pump gas? A new photography book explores the lure of these restorative community rest stops.

TITLE: ‘Ballerina Farm’ Gave Birth Two Weeks Ago. Now It’s Time For a Beauty Pageant.
SUMMARY: Hannah Neeleman, a Utah homemaker with a huge social media following, goes to Las Vegas, newborn in tow, to compete for Mrs. World.

TITLE: Squeezed by Soaring Rent, Small Shops Get Creative
SUMMARY: Some ambitious entrepreneurs in New York City are experimenting with diversified business models to connect with shoppers and bring in more money.

TITLE: What’s Behind This $10 Chicken Over Rice? An $18,000 Permit.
SUMMARY: Blame rising costs, shrunken crowds and a black-market permit trade. Chicken over rice costs $10 at the Halal Plates, a cart in Lower Manhattan, up from $6 prepandemic.

TITLE: Protecting the Rights of Independent Contractors
SUMMARY: Readers who are self-employed react to an Opinion guest essay. Also: Nikki Haley; fears of extinction; cutting sociology; the agony of the bulls.

TITLE: After Figma’s $20 Billion Windfall Evaporated, It’s Picking Up the Pieces
SUMMARY: Regulatory scrutiny felled the sale of Figma, a design platform, to Adobe. Now it’s grappling with employee expectations and a changing market.

TITLE: Kam Ghaffarian’s Moonshots
SUMMARY: The entrepreneur wants to help build the new space economy, one Prada spacesuit and Jeff Koons-filled lunar lander at a time.

TITLE: Inside the Funding Frenzy at Anthropic, One of A.I.’s Hottest Start-Ups
SUMMARY: The company raised $7.3 billion over the last year, as the lure of artificial intelligence changes Silicon Valley deal-making.

TITLE: Beaufort Watches Is One of the Four Brands in New Zealand
SUMMARY: Robert Kwok founded Beaufort Watches, one of only four such businesses now operating in New Zealand.

TITLE: How Minimum Wage Changes Affect Tipped Workers and Diners
SUMMARY: Higher prices? Fewer places? As several states consider lifting wages for tipped workers, here’s how the shift is already playing out in the nation’s capital.

TITLE: Off the Board Game, Onto the Digital Canvas
SUMMARY: Are role-playing games enriching culture, or destroying it? In two shows, the artist Simon Denny spoofs the grandiose fantasy worlds of tech entrepreneurs designing virtual reality.

TITLE: John Walker, Tech Executive Who Popularized AutoCAD, Dies at 74
SUMMARY: He avoided the spotlight, but he helped bring to market an explosively popular computer program that revolutionized the architecture and design industries.

TITLE: These Startups Want to Make Palm Oil. In a Lab. Without Palm Trees.
SUMMARY: Palm oil. It’s in your snacks, your soap, pretty much everything. But palm oil plantations have caused vast deforestation. Can these three tech executives help fix things?

TITLE: Marc Lore Is Trying to Build the Amazon of Food Delivery
SUMMARY: Marc Lore, the entrepreneur behind Diapers.com and Jet.com, would like to disrupt food delivery. But he really wants to build a brand that actually lasts.

TITLE: Reddit’s Long, Rocky Road to an Initial Public Offering
SUMMARY: The site, a throwback to an earlier era of social media, is poised to go public as soon as next week. It hasn’t been easy to reach this point.

TITLE: In Silicon Valley, Venture Capital Meets a Generational Shift
SUMMARY: Big-name investors such as Reid Hoffman and Michael Moritz are pulling back, creating room for a new generation of tech power brokers.

TITLE: Young Entrepreneurs Find a Way to Indulge Their C.E.O. Dreams
SUMMARY: Fresh business school graduates are raising “search funds” from willing investors to buy companies they can lead.

TITLE: How Yannick Benjamin, a Sommelier and Marathoner, Spends His Sundays
SUMMARY: Yannick Benjamin has been training for the wheelchair race at the New York City Half Marathon, meditating and taking breaks to enjoy (but not critique) wine with his wife.

TITLE: Kemo Sabe Cowboy Hats, Worn by Beyoncé and Kevin Costner, Rise to Fame in Aspen
SUMMARY: Beyoncé, Shania Twain, Kevin Costner and many reality TV regulars are loyal customers of Kemo Sabe hats. The shop in Aspen can’t believe its luck.

TITLE: With TikTok Under Fire, Brands That Rely on It Worry
SUMMARY: Many companies, particularly in the beauty and fashion industries, have boosted sales through the platform. They don’t really have a backup plan.

TITLE: Inside Amira Yahyaoui’s Claims about Mos, a Student Aid Start-Up
SUMMARY: Amira Yahyaoui, a human rights activist, promoted the success of her student aid start-up, Mos. Some of her statements do not add up, according to internal data and people familiar with the company.

TITLE: As Wildfires Grow Fiercer, Some Companies Look to Rebuild the Tree Supply Chain
SUMMARY: As forests succumb to ever-fiercer wildfires, the federal government and some adventurous private companies are trying to resuscitate an industry.

TITLE: In a New Cannabis Landscape, a Navy Veteran Battles for Racial Equity
SUMMARY: Wanda James is on a mission to empower entrepreneurs from communities harmed by racial disparities in marijuana arrests.

TITLE: Some NYC Restaurants Try Out Virtual Staff Who Take Orders Via Zoom
SUMMARY: A few New York City restaurants are experimenting with virtual staff members, who greet customers onscreen via Zoom from the Philippines.

TITLE: War or No War, Ukrainians Aren’t Giving Up Their Coffee
SUMMARY: Coffee shops and kiosks are everywhere in Ukraine’s capital, their popularity both an act of wartime defiance and a symbol of closer ties to the rest of Europe.

TITLE: In the South, Gas Stations Are Temples of Commerce and Community
SUMMARY: Are they gas stations that serve food or restaurants that pump gas? A new photography book explores the lure of these restorative community rest stops.

TITLE: Should You Use an Anti-Wrinkle Straw?
SUMMARY: Another solution to a problem we didn’t know we had.

TITLE: Here’s Why This Bouquet of Red Roses Costs $72 in NYC.
SUMMARY: A dozen red roses is timeless. But its price tag is not. At Ditmars Flower Shop in Queens, where costs have soared in recent years, a bouquet is $72, up from $60 in 2019.

TITLE: Kit Vintage Is a Secondhand Oasis in Los Angeles
SUMMARY: A laid-back shop in Los Angeles is a semi-secret spot for celebrities and costume designers.

TITLE: Truth Social Has an Edge as Rival Right-Wing Apps Falter
SUMMARY: Donald Trump’s social media platform has outdistanced similar conservative sites such as Parler and Gettr, even as it lags far behind X and others.

TITLE: Start-Up Founder Sentenced to 18 Months in Prison for Fraud
SUMMARY: Manish Lachwani, who founded the software start-up HeadSpin, is the latest tech entrepreneur to face time in prison in recent years.

TITLE: After Figma’s $20 Billion Windfall Evaporated, It’s Picking Up the Pieces
SUMMARY: Regulatory scrutiny felled the sale of Figma, a design platform, to Adobe. Now it’s grappling with employee expectations and a changing market.

TITLE: Binance Founder Should Get 3 Years in Prison, Prosecutors Say
SUMMARY: Lawyers for Changpeng Zhao, the founder of the crypto exchange Binance, countered that he should receive no prison time.

TITLE: Truth Social tiene una ventaja frente a las plataformas de derecha que flaquean
SUMMARY: La red social ha superado a la competencia sobre todo porque sus rivales han flaqueado. En marzo, registró 1,5 millones de visitantes únicos en Estados Unidos. La popularidad no asegura que sea rentable.

TITLE: ‘To the Future’: Saudi Arabia Spends Big to Become an A.I. Superpower
SUMMARY: The oil-rich kingdom is plowing money into glitzy events, computing power and artificial intelligence research, putting it in the middle of an escalating U.S.-China struggle for technological influence.

TITLE: A Return to New York and, Finally, an Apartment She Can Afford
SUMMARY: After moving 10 times in 10 years, a woman found that a little luck was the best companion for a lot of hard work. She won a studio in a lottery on her fifth try.

TITLE: Black Entrepreneurs, Frustrated by High Rates, Look to the Election
SUMMARY: In the battleground state of Georgia, some Black entrepreneurs are frustrated over the impact of higher interest rates, a source of economic anxiety.

TITLE: Binance’s Founder Plans a Comeback Even as He Faces Prison Time
SUMMARY: Since pleading guilty to violating money-laundering rules, Changpeng Zhao, who ran the giant crypto exchange Binance, has networked across the United States to set up his next act.

TITLE: Even as He Faces Prison Time, Binance’s Founder Plans a Comeback
SUMMARY: Since pleading guilty to violating money-laundering rules, Changpeng Zhao, who ran the giant crypto exchange Binance, has networked across the United States to set up his next act.

TITLE: The London Design Gallery at the Edge of Art and Design
SUMMARY: Carpenters Workshop Gallery has long pushed the limits of design. Now, they’ve made a bold bet on a new space in North Kensington. Will it pay off?
